SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

suncertify.db
Class DatabaseFileAccess

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.DatabaseFileAccess

 class DatabaseFileAccess
extends java.lang.Object

This is the worker class that does all the access and manipulation of the physical file which is the actual database.

Note: that since this should only be used by the DBAccessImp class, the class has been set to have default access.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Black

Field Summary
private static java.nio.charset.Charset CHAR_SET
          The Character Set used to read and store data to file.
private static java.util.concurrent.locks.ReadWriteLock databaseLock
          A ReentrantReadWrite Ensures that many users can read the cached Hash Map collection as long as nobody is updating it or writing to disk.
private static java.lang.String databasePath
          The location where the database file is stored.
private static java.io.RandomAccessFile dataFile
          The physical file on disk containing the Contractor records
private static int DELETED_FLAG
          The flag that implies deleted.
private static java.lang.String emptyContractorRecord
          A String which will be the same size as a Contractor record and filled with nulls.

          An array of respective field lengths
private static int[] fieldNameLengths
          An array of respective field lengths in each record.
private static java.lang.String[] fieldNames
          An array of respective field names for a record;
private static long LENGTH_OF_FLAG_BYTES
          The length in bytes of the deleted / valid flag at the beginning of each record.
private static int MAGIC_COOKIE
          The cookie that the file being used should have.
private static int numberOfFields
          The number of fields in a record.
private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,Contractor> recordCache
          A Map that contains cached records consisting of a Long (record number representing the position of the record on disk) as the key and a Contractor object as the value representing the record on disk.

recordCache

private static final java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,Contractor> recordCache
A Map that contains cached records consisting of a Long (record number representing the position of the record on disk) as the key and a Contractor object as the value representing the record on disk.

databaseLock

private static java.util.concurrent.locks.ReadWriteLock databaseLock
A ReentrantReadWrite Ensures that many users can read the cached Hash Map collection as long as nobody is updating it or writing to disk.

emptyContractorRecord

private static java.lang.String emptyContractorRecord
A String which will be the same size as a Contractor record and filled with nulls. Having this pre-built will save time and improve efficiency when writing to disk.

databasePath

private static java.lang.String databasePath
The location where the database file is stored.

Constructor Detail

DatabaseFileAccess

public DatabaseFileAccess(java.lang.String dbFilePath)
                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                          java.io.IOException
Default constructor that accepts the database path as a parameter.
All instances of this class share the same data file.

Parameters:
dbFilePath - the path to the database file directory
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the database file cannot be found.
java.io.IOException - if the database file cannot be read or written to.
Method Detail

updateCache

private void updateCache()
                  throws java.io.IOException
This is a private method used to update the record cache that in turn will be used and manipulated before updating the file on disk .

Throws:
java.io.IOException - throws an exception if any problems occur with disk access.

magicCookieCheck

private boolean magicCookieCheck()
                          throws java.io.IOException
This private method is used to compare the magic cookie to be used with the magic cookie stored on the data file, therefore ensuring the correct file and shema is being used.

Returns:
a boolean to indicate the correct magic cookie.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading the file.

setSchema

private void setSchema()
                throws java.io.IOException
This private method populates the schema arrays used to update the recordCache.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is a problem reading the file.

readRecord

public java.lang.String[] readRecord(long recNo)
                              throws RecordNotFoundException
This public method is used to return a records information as a String array using the file position record number.

Parameters:
recNo - a long used to locate the record.
Returns:
a String array with the record information.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exist or deleted.

updateRecord

public void updateRecord(long recNo,
                         java.lang.String[] data)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException
This public method is used to update a records information using a String array and the file position record number.

Parameters:
recNo - a long used to locate the record.
data - the String array used to update the record information.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exist or deleted.

deleteRecord

public void deleteRecord(long recNo)
                  throws RecordNotFoundException
This public method is used to delete a record using a long to locate the file position.

Parameters:
recNo - a long used to locate the record.
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if the record does not exist or deleted.

recordExists

public boolean recordExists(long recNo)
This private method checks to see if the record in question is deleted or exists at all.

Parameters:
recNo - the file position of the record in question.
Returns:
true is the record is valid or false if not valid or doesn't exist.

findByCriteria

public long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
Returns an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Field n in the database file is described by criteria[n]. A null value in criteria[n] matches any field value. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy").

Parameters:
criteria - The string array containing the name or location or both.
Returns:
the record numbers (file positions) as a long array.

createRecord

public long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException
Creates a new record in the database reusing a deleted entry file position to save disk space and inserts the given data.

Parameters:
data -
Returns:
a long, the record number of the new record.
Throws:
DuplicateKeyException - if a record with the same name and location exists.

saveRecord

private void saveRecord(long recNo,
                        Contractor contractor)
This method saves a particular record to the database file using the record number and a Contractor object.

Parameters:
recNo - the record number (file position).
contractor - a Contractor object to be saved.
